titleStmt.title: The ragman: or, A company that fell at oddes one day, which of them should carry the cunny skins away, they strove who should have it, but none of them wise, for the usurer and the devill carry away the przie [sic]. To the tune of Upon the highest mountaines, or, The absence of my mistresse.
titleStmt.author: Lookes, John.

notesStmt.note: Author, publisher, and date of publication suggested by Wing L3030B.
Verse: "There was a ragman and a mad man ..."
In two parts, printed side by side.
Imperfect: mutilated, affecting text and imprint.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
